data.title: Lt. General Sir John Doyle
data.meta_description: Three-quarter length portrait of Sir John Doyle with an Indian attendant. Mezzotint by William Say after James Ramsay, 1817.
data.meta_site_name: Victoria and Albert Museum: Explore the Collections
data.text:
Physical description

Three-quarter length portrait, to front, standing and looking and facing to left; wearing military uniform; pointing with right hand to a paper (terms of capitulation) held in left; a horse's head on the left with an Indian attendant; in right background cavalry and artillery are assembled.

Marks and inscriptions

'James Ramsay Esqr. pinxit. London Pub. Novr. 1 1817, by Thompson, 26 St. James's Street. W. Say sculp Engraver to H.R.H. the Duke of Gloucester. To His Royal Highness the Prince Regent This Portrait of Lt. General Sir John Doyle, Bart. G.C.B. K.C. Is humbly Dedicated by His Royal Highnesses most obedient & devoted servt. / John P. Thompson' (Lettered)
